instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on no brain?
threads.message:
Liquid damaged keyboard connector and around UA600.
I replaced a few caps that looked damaged (<CAPACITOR>C7274</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7290</CAPACITOR>, CA607) and retinned the keyboard connector.
I also reflowed UA600 to make sure that all pins are properly connected. 

The device turns on, takes 19.2V and 1.13A.
The fans start at normal speed and after a minute go high speed.
There is no activity on USB hdd.
The trackpad clicks.
No image, no keyboard backlight nor capslock light.

Both the CPU and the GPU gets hot.

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0.690V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> - 0.902V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on no brain?
threads.message:
Something else affected by corrosion; maybe bad CPU now.

Try known good working BIOS, just in case.
